title: Sanae Takaichi Elected LDP Leader, Set to Be Japan's First Female PM
snippets: Japan's governing party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country's first female prime minister.
If elected, Takaichi will face a host of issues, including an ageing population and growing unease about immigration.

Conservative hard-liner Takaichi is the former internal affairs minister of Japan. She holds hawkish views on China, and has also visited the controversial Yasukuni Shrine, which memorializes Japan's war dead.
Arch-conservative who models herself on Margaret Thatcher beats Shinjiro Koizumi in second-round party vote

Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic party

Japan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being ins
The new leader will take the helm of the world’s fourth-largest economy at a time of unusual political instability, rising prices and increasing regional tensions.
Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line conservative, was elected as leader by Japan’s embattled governing party, paving the way for her to become prime minister of the coalition government.
Ms. Takaichi would be Japan’s first female prime minister in a country where women are drastically underrepresented at the highest levels of power.

Japan’s governing party on Saturday elected former Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country’s first female prime minister. In a country that ranks poorly internationally for gender equality, t
titles: Japan's ruling party elects Sanae Takaichi as leader, likely to become first female PM
Japan’s LDP elects Takaichi as new leader, likely to be first female PM
Sanae Takaichi expected to be Japan's first female PM
Japan set for first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins leadership race
Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
Sanae Takaichi is set to become Japan’s first female prime minister
Japan Is Set for Its First Female Prime Minister
Sanae Takaichi Is Likely to Be Japan’s Next Leader. Who Is She?
Japan likely to get its first female PM as ruling party picks new leader
summary: Sanae Takaichi, a conservative hard-liner and former Economic Security Minister, has been elected as the new leader of Japan's governing Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), positioning her to become the country's first female prime minister. Takaichi, known for her admiration of Margaret Thatcher and hawkish views on China, won against her more moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a second-round party vote. Her leadership arrives amidst challenges such as political instability, an ageing population, rising prices, and regional tensions.

title: Blue Jays Drop Bichette for ALDS, Yesavage to Debut
snippets: The Blue Jays left shortstop Bo Bichette, who is recovering from a knee sprain, off their roster for the ALDS vs. the Yankees.
Trey Yesavage is expected to make his postseason debut with just three career regular-season starts to his credit
Bo Bichette will not be suiting up for the Toronto Blue Jays in the American League Division Series.
The Toronto Blue Jays will have to wait a little longer for Bo Bichette to make his return to the lineup.
titles: Blue Jays leave Bichette (knee) off ALDS roster
Blue Jays vs. Yankees: Bo Bichette left off Toronto roster for ALDS, along with two notable starting pitchers
Bichette ruled out for ALDS against Yankees
Blue Jays’ Bo Bichette ruled out of ALDS against Yankees
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays have excluded shortstop Bo Bichette from their roster for the ALDS against the Yankees due to his recovery from a knee sprain. In his absence, Trey Yesavage is set to make his postseason debut after only three regular-season starts.

title: Hamas Agrees to Release Hostages, Engages in Peace Talks with Trump's Plan
snippets: Hamas agreed to release the hostages and to the idea of handing over governing Gaza to Palestinian technocrats, but did not give a clear response to many other elements.
Hamas accepted parts of US President Trump’s 20-point Gaza ceasefire plan but wants more talks on several key points.
Hope-filled reactions follow Hamas’s response, which marks a potential turning point in Israel's two-year war on Gaza.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMif0FVX3lxTE1vUzN3NUNhdW5KdGZNLW0tdndmRk0tU3p3aDhxMkdHLW84YVJCTGR0RnFvTl8zVHNLU090NTBfMEpzN3JFbUQ1VERoV1phR1RRX1g0QXhnWmk3ektQTFdNZFBDcm8ydERPWVI3U01vaGZfMHR5cy1jTm5qV1NYLVE?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas resp
Hamas responded to President Trump's proposal for peace in Gaza, saying it will release all remaining hostages if Israel withdraws from Gaza and "proper field conditions are met."
titles: Shock in Gaza as Trump appears to welcome Hamas response to US peace plan
What we know about Hamas’ response to Trump’s Gaza peace plan
World reacts to Hamas’s response to Trump’s Gaza plan
Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas responds to peace plan - Axios
WATCH:  Hamas responds to President Trump's proposal to end Gaza war
summary: Hamas has agreed to release Israeli hostages and accepted parts of President Trump's peace plan to end the nearly two-year war, but seeks further negotiations on many terms. Trump has ordered Israel to immediately stop bombing Gaza, signaling a potential move towards peace. Despite not fully agreeing to the U.S. proposal, Hamas's willingness to discuss the plan and release hostages has been acknowledged by Trump as a step towards achieving lasting peace in the Middle East.

title: Russell Clinches Pole at Singapore GP, Edges Out Verstappen and Piastri
snippets: Mercedes' George Russell beats Max Verstappen and the McLarens to pole position for the Singapore Grand Prix.
Mercedes' George Russell beats Max Verstappen and the McLarens to pole position for the Singapore Grand Prix.

• Rejuvenated Mercedes driver takes top spot by 0.182sec

  • Title leader Oscar Piastri in third, Lando Norris fifth

George Russell claimed pole position for the Singapore Grand Prix, putting in a magnificent lap between the walls of the Marina Bay street circuit

George Russell delivered a virtuoso performance under the lights to claim a stunning pole for Mercedes for the Singapore Grand Prix as second-placed Max Verstappen also outqualified the title-leading McLaren drivers.
titles: Russell claims stunning Singapore pole
Russell claims stunning Singapore pole
Impressive Russell holds off Verstappen to grab F1 Singapore GP pole
Russell storms to Singapore pole as Verstappen beats McLarens too
summary: George Russell of Mercedes secured pole position for the Singapore Grand Prix, outperforming Max Verstappen and both McLaren drivers, including title leader Oscar Piastri who placed third. Russell's impressive lap at the Marina Bay street circuit placed him 0.182 seconds ahead of Verstappen, showcasing a significant performance boost for Mercedes.

title: Hamas Agrees to Release Hostages, Engages in Peace Talks with Trump's Plan
snippets: US president ordered Israel to cease bombing but Gaza residents report scattered explosions
President Trump said he believed Hamas was “ready for a lasting peace” after the militant group offered to release hostages and discuss the U.S.-led peace proposal.
Hamas said it would agree to some parts of President Trump's peace plan, but held back on endorsing the entire initiative, which calls for it to lay down its weapons.
titles: Israel prepares for hostage release after Hamas agrees to parts of Trump’s peace plan
Trump Calls on Israel to Stop Bombing Gaza After Hamas Agrees to Parts of Cease-Fire Plan
Hamas agrees to return hostages but resists other parts of Trump's peace plan
summary: Hamas has agreed to release Israeli hostages and accepted parts of President Trump's peace plan to end the nearly two-year war, but seeks further negotiations on many terms. Trump has ordered Israel to immediately stop bombing Gaza, signaling a potential move towards peace. Despite not fully agreeing to the U.S. proposal, Hamas's willingness to discuss the plan and release hostages has been acknowledged by Trump as a step towards achieving lasting peace in the Middle East.

title: Sean "Diddy" Combs Sentenced to Over 4 Years for Prostitution Charges
snippets: The US rapper and record producer was convicted over sexual encounters, capping a sordid federal case that featured harrowing testimony. The judge said "these were serious offenses that irreparably harmed two women."

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihwFBVV95cUxNNGVad0ZMd0hIWDZMV1dpdmxQZ2tTdTM2UncxRlMtLWlGdkM2aEZrMHEwb3dCejM2RGRiYXFmcW5XTHdRQ2VFcEJaX0YxYlphV2hLNzd6UlpKUTd2OGtpenNxM3laXzVLYnVvS3I2bXI1US1yc0IxaUxHRGZHQkVnVF9nQkc3Um8?oc=5" target="_blank">Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to four years f
Sean Combs sat expressionless in his seat when the judge sentenced him to just over four years in prison Friday for his conviction on two prostitution-related offenses.

NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs was sentenced Friday to four years and two months in prison for transporting people across state lines for sexual encounters, capping a sordid federal case that featured harrowing testimony and ended in a forceful reckoning for one of the most influe
titles: US: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to over 4 years in prison
Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to four years for prostitution charges - Axios
WATCH:  Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to 50 months in prison
Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs is sentenced to over 4 years in prison
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to 4 years and 2 months in prison after being convicted on two counts of transportation for prostitution. In his trial, he admitted his actions were "disgusting" and "shameful." Despite his plea for leniency and the prosecution's push for a longer sentence of 11 years and three months, the judge determined the crimes caused irreparable harm to two women and emphasized the need for a lengthy sentence to serve as a deterrent.

title: U.S. Strike Kills 4 on Suspected Drug Boat in Caribbean
snippets: The US said it carried out another strike on a small boat in the Caribbean Sea, killing four people on board. Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth said "narco-terrorists" were the target.

Pentagon chief says strike – fourth by US military in recent weeks – targeted boat with ‘substantial amounts’ of drugs

The United States carried out a strike against an alleged drug-trafficking boat on Friday that killed four people, US defense secretary
The U.S. strike near Venezuela is the latest in the Trump administration’s legally nebulous campaign targeting Latin American drug cartels.
It was the fourth strike in the Trump administration’s legally disputed campaign targeting suspected drug runners in the Caribbean Sea.
titles: US strikes drug alleged boat near Venezuelan waters
Hegseth says four killed in US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuelan coast
U.S. kills 4 alleged drug smugglers near Venezuela, Hegseth says
U.S. Military Attacked Boat Off Venezuela, Killing Four Men, Hegseth Says
summary: The U.S. conducted a strike in the Caribbean Sea, killing four individuals on a boat suspected of drug trafficking. This action, confirmed by Pentagon Chief Pete Hegseth, marks the fourth similar strike by the U.S. military under the Trump administration's campaign against Latin American drug cartels. The operation is part of a series targeting vessels believed to be carrying substantial amounts of drugs.

title: Munich Airport Reopens After Drone Sightings Affect 6,500
snippets: Munich Airport reopens after second drone disruption in 24 hrs; over 6,500 affected as EU faces surge in mysterious drone flyovers near key infrastructure.

MUNICH (AP) — Germany’s Munich Airport reopened Saturday morning after authorities shut it down the night before for the second time in less than 24 hours after two additional drone sightings, officials said. The closures are the latest after mysterious drone overflights in the airspace
titles: Germany’s Munich Airport reopens after second closure in less than 24 hours due to drones
Germany’s Munich Airport reopens after second closure in less than 24 hours due to drones
summary: Munich Airport reopened after being closed twice in less than 24 hours due to drone sightings, affecting over 6,500 people. This incident is part of a surge in mysterious drone activities near key infrastructure across the EU.

title: Canada Post Workers' Union Rejects New Contract Offer as Step Backward
snippets: The union representing striking Canada Post workers says the latest offer from the company is worse than the deal they "overwhlemingly rejected in a vote two months ago."

The union representing Canada Post workers says the Crown corporation is taking a major step backwards with its latest contract offers. In a statement released Friday, the union says it is disappointed with an offer that includes less than one it rejected in August. Canada Post tabled an offer Frida
titles: Canada Post’s latest offers ‘worse’ than before, union says
Canada Post union says latest contract offer is step backwards
summary: The union for Canada Post workers has rejected the latest contract offer from the company, stating it is worse than the one overwhelmingly voted down two months ago. They expressed disappointment, highlighting that the new proposal is a step backward from the previously declined offer made in August.

title: Aces Rally to Beat Mercury 89-86 in WNBA Finals Game 1
snippets: The Las Vegas Aces take game one of the WNBA Finals over the Phoenix Mercury. Historically, teams that win the first game of the series overwhelmingly win the WNBA title.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMingFBVV95cUxNSl9iUDJJd1dxaG1CYkZDZkV6TTMtWDZWRUQzWDhTOEpmaWhuVXowbXpOaU90My1VMWxWTGFmWmRtSUJWSXJmUDlGQ3drZFNKbDZkMEZrR2tOY3U4TmVTd3l3RGQwbXhSTXJmZzZNWlR4V3VraWZKdVJFMEU4Ym9xd0dnemx0MDJ3aHpIeGxVVUd1SjJKN3FtUXRVYlNoUQ?oc=5" target="_blank">What We Learn

The Aces series-opening win against the Mercury was an appetizer into how these teams, and in particular, how A’ja Wilson and Alyssa Thomas could match up for the rest of the series.

Kai Gammage covers that and more in his takeaways from Game 1 of the WNBA Finals.
titles: Las Vegas Aces Take WNBA Finals Game One Over The Phoenix Mercury
What We Learned From Aces' Thrilling WNBA Finals Win Over Mercury in Game 1 - Sports Illustrated
WNBA Finals Game 1 Takeaways: Wilson, Aces get upper hand vs. Thomas, Mercury
summary: The Las Vegas Aces rallied in the fourth quarter to defeat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in Game 1 of the WNBA Finals in Las Vegas. After trailing for most of the game, the Aces' late surge secured them the opening victory. Historically, winning the first game significantly increases a team's chances of claiming the WNBA title.

title: Zverev Claims Courts Slowed to Favor Alcaraz, Sinner

summary: Tennis player Alexander Zverev accuses tournament organizers of intentionally slowing down courts to benefit top players Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner. Zverev claims this is being done to favor the two players.

snippets: North Carolina is turning to senior quarterback Max Johnson to start against Clemson after Gio Lopez was ruled out.
UNC football will turn to veteran quarterback Max Johnson as the Tar Heels' starting QB vs. Clemson. Gio Lopez is out with an injury.

title: Wild Sign Goalie Gustavsson to $34M, 5-Year Extension
snippets: The Wild completed a second major piece of business this week as they signed starting goaltender Filip Gustavsson to a five-year, $34 million extension.
Goaltender Filip Gustavsson is signing a five-year, $34 million contract extension with the Wild, Sportsnet’s Elliotte Friedman reported on Saturday.
titles: Wild give goalie Gustavsson 5-year, $34M deal
Wild signing G Filip Gustavsson to five-year, $34M contract extension
summary: The Wild have signed goaltender Filip Gustavsson to a five-year contract extension worth $34 million, as reported by Sportsnet's Elliotte Friedman. This marks the team's second major deal this week.

title: US President Urges Israel to Stop Gaza Bombings Amid Peace Efforts
snippets: Both sides have backed President Trump’s peace plan to free all Israeli hostages — but key differences remain on how Israel’s military would withdraw from Gaza.
The plan aims to secure the release of Israeli hostages held in the Gaza Strip and end a two-year conflict that has reduced much of the enclave to rubble.
Israel said it would cooperate with the White House to end the war, but much is still unclear about Hamas’s future and whether it will agree to disarm.
titles: Israel pauses Gaza City push after Hamas accepts Trump plan with conditions
Hamas accepts Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza, but with conditions
Israel and Hamas Say They’ll Work With Trump’s Gaza Plan, but Gaps Remain
summary: The US President has called on Israel to halt bombings in Gaza, indicating Hamas's willingness for a 'lasting peace.' This move is part of a peace plan aimed at ending a two-year conflict and securing the release of Israeli hostages in Gaza. While Hamas agrees to aspects of the plan, it hesitates to fully endorse the proposal, particularly the demand to disarm.

title: Babis Wins Czech Election, Proposes Ukraine Aid Cuts
snippets: Billionaire Andrej Babis wants to cut aid to Ukraine, and now he is the projected winner of the Czech parliamentary elections. With 90% of districts reporting, his party took 36% of the vote.
The party of Andrej Babis, former leader of the Czech government, is expected to prevail in parliamentary elections that begin Friday.
titles: Czech Republic: 'Trumpist' ex-PM Babis wins elections
‘Czech Trump’ Andrej Babis Is Poised to Return as Prime Minister in Elections
summary: Andrej Babis, a billionaire who has proposed cutting aid to Ukraine, is the projected winner of the Czech parliamentary elections, with his party securing 36% of the vote after 90% of districts reported.

title: Over 100 Arrested at London Vigil for Banned Group Amid Attack Concerns
snippets: Demonstrations went ahead in central London despite calls from politicians and police leaders for the protests to be postponed in wake of the Manchester synagogue attack.

Officers arrest activists at silent vigil in support of banned organisation

Police have made more than a 100 arrests in Trafalgar Square at what organisers hoped would be the biggest demonstration so far against a ban on the proscribed organisation Palestine Action.

Officers began arr
titles: Police make 175 arrests at pro-Palestinian protest in London
Police make arrests at Palestine Action protest as demo goes ahead despite PM’s pleas
summary: In central London, despite requests to postpone due to the recent Manchester synagogue attack, demonstrations occurred. At a silent vigil in Trafalgar Square, supporting the banned group Palestine Action, police arrested over 100 activists. This event was intended to be the largest protest against the prohibition of the organization.
